summary: An independent financial condition report prepared by Macalvins Limited for Cohen & Gresser LLP, summarizing Ghislaine Maxwell's financial status from 2015 to 2020. It details her assets, liabilities, net worth, and financial transfers, noting the absence of significant asset alienation and addressing government claims about transfers from Jeffrey Epstein. The report was prepared under engagement for her legal defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central subject of the financial condition report detailing her assets, net worth, and financial transfers from 2015 to 2020. She is noted as facing criminal charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Associate, source of earlier financial transfers
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to government claims of over $20 million in transfers between his accounts and Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts during 2007-2011, and as a donor to her charity.

connections.description: The report references government claims of substantial financial transfers between Epstein's accounts and Maxwell's accounts during 2007-2011, and notes a donation from Epstein's foundation to Maxwell's charity in 2013.

events.title: Sale of New York City Property
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell sold a residential property in New York City for $15,075,000, with proceeds tracked in the report.

events.title: Marriage and Asset Transfer
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell married and began filing joint US tax returns. She transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse.

events.title: Dissolution of Terramar Charities
events.description: Terramar Project Inc and Terramar UK, charities founded by Ghislaine Maxwell, ceased operations and were dissolved.

events.title: Preparation of Financial Condition Report
events.description: Macalvins Limited prepares this financial condition report under engagement from Cohen & Gresser LLP for Ghislaine Maxwell's legal defense.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's net worth was approximately $20.2 million at the start of 2015 and approximately $22.5 million as of October 31, 2020, including about $7.67 million in advance legal retainer fees.

The report finds no alienation of assets from 2015-2020 beyond ordinary family expenditure and substantial legal defense costs, and no significant transfers of the nature previously alleged by the government (referencing 2007-2011) occurred in the 2015-2020 period.
In 2016, Maxwell transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse.

The report reviews but finds no evidence of personal financial benefit to Maxwell from the Terramar Project Inc and Terramar UK charities, to which she contributed over $570,000 and which received a $57,000 donation from the Epstein Interests Foundation in 2013.
The report is limited by an inability to access all historic bank statements and perform a full audit due to the Covid-19 pandemic and Maxwell's detention conditions.
